citation.article-title: Taxonomic study of the genus Salinicola: transfer of Halomonas salaria and Chromohalobacter salarius to the genus Salinicola as Salinicola salarius comb. nov. and Salinicola halophilus nom. nov., respectively
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Salinicola salarius comb. nov.
Salinicola salarius (sa.la′ri.us L. masc. adj. salarius of or belonging to salt).
Basonym: Halomonas salaria Kim et al. 2007.
The description is the same as that for Halomonas salaria (Kim et al., 2007), with the following additions.
Exopolysaccharide is not produced.
Poly-β-hydroxyalkanoate is produced.
Respiration on fumarate, nitrate and nitrite is negative.
Methyl red and phosphatase tests are positive.
Glucose is fermented.
Tween 20 is hydrolysed.
Tyrosine is not hydrolysed.
Lysine- and ornithine-decarboxylase-negative.
Gluconate is not oxidized.
Selenite is not reduced.

The following compounds are used as sole carbon and energy sources: cellobiose, fructose, d-galactose, lactose, raffinose, starch, butanol, dulcitol, ethanol, glycerol, propanol, xylitol and fumarate.
The following compounds are used as sole carbon, nitrogen and energy sources: l-arginine, isoleucine, l-lysine and l-ornithine.
The following compounds are not used as sole carbon and energy sources: aesculin, melezitose, salicin, trehalose, d-xylose, methanol, benzoate, formate, hippurate, succinate and tartrate.
The following compounds are not used as sole carbon, nitrogen and energy sources: aspartate, l-cysteine, glutamine, l-methionine, phenylalanine, l-threonine, tryptophan and valine.

Resistant to cephalothin (30 μg), sulfamethoxazole/trimethoprim (23.75/1.25 μg), kanamycin (30 μg), erythromycin (15 μg), neomycin (10 μg), nalidixic acid (30 μg), rifampicin (30 μg), bacitracin (10 units) and novobiocin (30 μg).
The polar lipids comprise phospholipids, aminolipids and phosphoglycolipids.
The type strain is M27T (=KCTC 12664T =DSM 18044T).
